ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: A general study in the evolution of Spanish from Latin to modern usage. Useful to anyone studying the Spanish language.
Take it for a thorough introduction to history of Spanish.
I would certainly recommend the course for anyone interested in the development of the Spanish language.

I would recommend the class for any student of spanish-language literature. It could get rather dry at times (linguistics) but makes for a useful foundation for anyone interested in Romance philology.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I'm not sure that this course will directly contribute to my dissertation research, however, the understanding of how our language developed has already proven itself useful for the reading of Medieval texts integral to a deep and complete knowledge of the literary canon.
